intro: Brodiaea uniflora var. violacea, commonly known as the violet-flowered brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and a single, showy violet-blue flower that blooms in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. The flower's coloration and structure make it a striking addition to rock gardens and native plant collections.
